Dear Ms. Carey:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
July 23, 2017. Due to the violation, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the MSA
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan.
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and
date an updated treatment plan for each resident at
least once every 90-calendar days following the
initial treatment plan.
Three of ten service plans were completed 4, 2 and 1 day
late.
2.) The facility is in compliance with all ISEP requirements.
3.) The facility is in compliance with all DHHS Contract/Policy requirements.
4

IV. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
No CAPs were required for special investigations. The Interim report of 2017
cited Tuberculosis screening and Discharge plans. One CAP involved creating
ticklers to email employees when TB tests are due. In addition, employee files
are being audited quarterly for compliance. Another CAP involved the program
director assuring that all sections of the action summary (DHS-69b) are filled
out prior to approving.
V. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that
the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
